timeline.bodyText:
you don't have to check isBlank, you were only checking that previously because that was your default value.
Lets talk about let.

docs
inline fun <T, R> T.let(block: (T) -> R): R
lets break it down, T.let this means that anything of Type T has a function called let, T is generic so all objects have a let function
block: (T) -> R let accepts a parameter called block, what this parameter is is a function. that takes a T (T) and returns an R ->R. The easiest way to supply a function in kotlin is just to write { }. We want a function that takes a T so we can write an exampleFunction
"myString".let({ myStringAsAVariable -> print(myStringAsAVariable )})

but there are some kotlin features to make this less annoying to write.
if the last paramter of a function is another function then we can put it outside the (), when the only parameter is a function we can also omit the () altogether
"myString".let() { myStringAsAVariable -> print(myStringAsAVariable ) }
"myString".let { myStringAsAVariable -> print(myStringAsAVariable ) }

when you only have 1 parameter to a lambda ie myStringAsAVariable you don't even need to declare it and can instead reference it as it
"myString".let{ print(it) }

replies.bodyText:
We did want to take advantage of the default arguments so your instincts were correct. It is because all these methods have the same name that this didn't work out. We could fix this by simply renaming the internal private method to createAndShowDialogSafely.
The API of this function is still unfortunately quite difficult to work with but this is because everything is calling it from java after all. I think my current design on kiwix is good from the api perspective, if you have curiosity about what this can be like in kotlin then I would suggest a quick read of AlertDialogShower, KiwixDialog which allow the showing of a dialog to be as simple as
dialogShower.show(StopDownload, { downloader.cancelDownload(it.downloadId) })

To be clear this is not saying you have to rewrite this class to look like those classes, that would be out of scope for this ticket
